availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Stage coach business in central Kentucky. Originally Irvine, Hawkins, & Co., founded 1851. Operated from 1855 to 1865. Owners names: Thomas H. Irvine, Silas Wolverton, Augustus Rogers, William H. Winn, M. Hayden Jouett. Transported troops (U.S.A.) in late 1862 and early 1863.

ab.bibl: J. Winston Coleman, Jr., Stage-coach Days in the Bluegrass, being an account of stage-coach travel and tavern days in Lexington and central Kentucky, 1800-1900, (Louisville: The Standard Press, 1935), p.205, 268.
